t: Capybara | Rainforest Alliance
s: February 12, 2025 - Capybaras are the largest rodents on earth. They can weigh more than 100 lbs (45 kg) and grow to be 4 feet (1.2 m) long and 2 feet (0.6 m) tall — much larger than their guinea pig relatives! t: Are capybaras rodents? And 5 other capybara facts | Stories | WWF
s: Meet the capybara (Hydrochoerus hydrochaeris), the largest rodent in the world! Native to South America, you can find capybaras scampering by the edges of mucky marshes, swimming through jungle ponds, and snacking in flooded grasslands. t: How the Capybara Won My Heart—and Almost Everyone Else’s | The New Yorker
s: January 27, 2025 - Gary Shteyngart, the author of “The Russian Debutante’s Handbook” and “Our Country Friends,” reports on the craze for capybaras on Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok, and travels to Japan, Argentina, Brazil, and Florida to spend time with the giant rodent.

t: Save the Capybara and the Amazon | GreaterGood
s: March 20, 2025 - Deforestation is putting the capybara and countless other species at risk of extinction. Call on Congress to reduce our contribution to deforestation in the Amazon!

t: If Deforestation in the Amazon Continues, the Rainforest Could Become a Dry Savannah, Devastating Capybaras and Other Species | GreaterGood
s: June 4, 2024 - If we don't act now, the rainforest could become a dry savannah, and the loss of this unique ecosystem would have far-reaching consequences for the global climate and the livelihoods of millions of people.

t: Capybara - ShopZoo
